analysis.Summary: Vue component that renders a horizontal slider of “hot” blog posts, fetching data from the community blog store and displaying each post via a CardBlogpost component.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a reusable UI section in the community module for displaying a customizable, paginated slider of featured or recent blog posts.

Components.name: Slider
Components.responsibility: Wrapper that handles list fetching, pagination and carousel behavior; exposes a default slot for rendering each item.

Components.name: CardBlogpost
Components.responsibility: Presentation component that displays individual blog post metadata (title, author, preview) in a card format.

Functions.name: store.read
Functions.description: Asynchronous loader passed to the Slider component to fetch a page of blog posts from the community store.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Additional paging or filter options (currently unused in the implementation).

Functions.implementation: blog.read({ skip, limit, user: userId, period, category })

analysis.Usage: Imported into parent views or pages (e.g. Community homepage) via `import HotPosts from '.../HotPosts.vue'` and used as `<HotPosts :skip="0" :limit="8" :userId="someUserId" period="week" category="featured" />` to render the slider.
Notes: The component uses the `<script setup>` syntax for concise setup of props and imports.
The Feed import is included but not referenced in template—likely a leftover and can be removed.
Default `userId` prop reads from the auth store at import time; changes in auth.state.user._id after mount will not update this default.
Styles define a responsive slide width: 25% on large screens and 75% on narrower viewports (≤1025px).
Only English locale is provided in the `text` prop for the no-data message.
